title: Tunisia's budget will rise in 2020 to $16.4 billion: finance minister
text:
Tunisia's Finance Minister, Ridha Chalgoum speaks at a news conference in Tunis, Tunisia October 17, 2017. REUTERS/Ulf Laessing

TUNIS (Reuters) - Tunisia’s state budget will rise from 40 billion dinars in 2019 to 47 billion dinars in 2020 ($16.4 billion), TAP state news agency quoted Finance Minister Ridha Chalgoum saying on Monday.

The deficit in 2020 is targeted at 3% of gross domestic product (GDP), compared to the 3.9%-of-GDP deficit that Prime Minister Youssef Chahed has said is expected this year.
description: Tunisia's state budget will rise from 40 billion dinars in 2019 to 47 billion dinars in 2020 ($16.4 billion), TAP state news agency quoted Finance Minister Ridha Chalgoum saying on Monday.
